# v1.1.0 Detailed Issues - Ready to Create

Detailed, ready-to-paste issue templates for v1.1.0.

---

## Issue 1: Promote multiagent new to GA

**Title**: `[v1.1] Promote multiagent new from preview to GA`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `feature`, `cli`

**Milestone**: `v1.1.0`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Promote `multiagent new` command from preview to General Availability (GA) with full CLI entry point and rich templates.

## Current Status

- ✅ Preview implementation exists in `scripts/multiagent_new.py`
- ✅ CLI entry point: `multiagent-new` (via pyproject.toml)
- ✅ Basic scaffold generation works
- ⏳ Needs promotion to stable API

## Goals

### 1. CLI Entry Point
- [ ] Add `multiagent` main CLI entry point (not just `multiagent-new`)
- [ ] Update `pyproject.toml` scripts section
- [ ] Ensure `multiagent new` works as subcommand

### 2. Templates
- [ ] **static-site** - Static website generator
  - Markdown → HTML conversion
  - Basic styling (Tailwind or similar)
  - GitHub Pages ready
- [ ] **api-service** - REST API service (FastAPI)
  - FastAPI boilerplate
  - OpenAPI docs
  - Basic CRUD endpoints
- [ ] **etl-pipeline** - ETL pipeline template
  - Data extraction
  - Transformation logic
  - Loading to target

### 3. Flags
- [ ] `--preset` - Use preset configuration (mvp-fast, production, research)
- [ ] `--with-ci` - Include CI/CD setup (GitHub Actions)
- [ ] `--with-docs` - Include documentation setup
- [ ] `--with-examples` - Include example pipelines

### 4. Documentation
- [ ] Update main README with `multiagent new` usage
- [ ] Create template documentation
- [ ] Add examples for each template

### 5. Testing
- [ ] Add tests for each template
- [ ] Test all flags
- [ ] Integration tests

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `multiagent new` works as main command
- [ ] All 3 templates generate valid projects
- [ ] All flags work correctly
- [ ] Generated projects pass validation
- [ ] Documentation complete
- [ ] Tests pass (coverage ≥ 80%)

## Example Usage

```bash
# Generate static site
multiagent new static-site --output ./my-site --with-ci --with-docs

# Generate API service
multiagent new api-service --output ./my-api --preset production

# Generate ETL pipeline
multiagent new etl-pipeline --output ./my-etl --with-examples
```

## Related

- See `docs/V1.1_ROADMAP.md` for full roadmap
- See `scripts/multiagent_new.py` for current implementation
```

---

## Issue 2: Pipelines Gallery

**Title**: `[v1.1] Create Pipelines Gallery with 5 Reference Examples`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `gallery`, `documentation`, `examples`

**Milestone**: `v1.1.0`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Create a Pipelines Gallery showcasing 5 complete, production-ready pipeline examples with documentation, visualizations, and one-command execution.

## Gallery Structure

```
pipeline/gallery/
├── README.md                    # Gallery index
├── static-site/
│   ├── pipeline.yaml
│   ├── README.md
│   ├── pipeline.dot
│   ├── pipeline.png
│   └── sample_report.md
├── api-service/
│   ├── pipeline.yaml
│   ├── README.md
│   ├── pipeline.dot
│   ├── pipeline.png
│   └── sample_report.md
├── etl-pipeline/
│   ├── pipeline.yaml
│   ├── README.md
│   ├── pipeline.dot
│   ├── pipeline.png
│   └── sample_report.md
├── cli-tool/
│   ├── pipeline.yaml
│   ├── README.md
│   ├── pipeline.dot
│   ├── pipeline.png
│   └── sample_report.md
└── microservice/
    ├── pipeline.yaml
    ├── README.md
    ├── pipeline.dot
    ├── pipeline.png
    └── sample_report.md
```

## Pipeline Examples

### 1. Static Site Generator
**Use Case**: Generate static website from markdown
**Agents**: Requirements, Architecture, Frontend, Docs
**Output**: Static HTML site with styling

### 2. REST API Service
**Use Case**: FastAPI service with OpenAPI docs
**Agents**: Requirements, Backend, API Design, Testing
**Output**: Complete API service

### 3. ETL Pipeline
**Use Case**: Data extraction, transformation, loading
**Agents**: Requirements, Data Modeler, Backend, Testing
**Output**: ETL pipeline code

### 4. CLI Tool
**Use Case**: Command-line utility
**Agents**: Requirements, Architecture, Backend, Docs
**Output**: CLI tool with help

### 5. Microservice
**Use Case**: Microservice with Docker
**Agents**: Requirements, Architecture, Backend, DevOps, Testing
**Output**: Complete microservice

## Requirements

### Each Pipeline Must Include

- [ ] **pipeline.yaml** - Complete, working pipeline
  - All stages defined
  - Dependencies specified
  - Min scores set
- [ ] **README.md** - Documentation
  - Description
  - Use case
  - Quick start (one command)
  - Expected output
  - Screenshots (if applicable)
- [ ] **pipeline.dot** - Graph visualization (DOT format)
- [ ] **pipeline.png** - Rendered graph
- [ ] **sample_report.md** - Sample execution report

### Gallery Index

- [ ] **pipeline/gallery/README.md**
  - Overview of all pipelines
  - Quick links to each
  - Comparison table
  - "Run this" examples

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All 5 pipelines work end-to-end
- [ ] Each pipeline has complete documentation
- [ ] Visual assets (DOT/PNG) included
- [ ] Sample reports generated
- [ ] Gallery accessible from main README
- [ ] One-command execution works for each

## Example Gallery Entry

```markdown
## Static Site Generator

Generate a static website from markdown files.

**Run this**:
```bash
python cli.py --pipeline pipeline/gallery/static-site/pipeline.yaml --preset mvp-fast
```

**Output**: `out/<run_id>/static-site/`

[View full documentation](static-site/README.md)
```

## Related

- See `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/v1.1-pipelines-gallery.md` for detailed spec
- See `docs/V1.1_ROADMAP.md` for roadmap
```

## Issue 3: Plugin API Tests

**Title**: `[v1.1] Add External Test Plugin for CI Validation`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `plugin-api`, `test`, `ci`

**Milestone**: `v1.1.0`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Create external test plugin repository and integrate into CI to validate Plugin API works correctly and guard against regressions.

## Current Status

- ✅ Plugin loader infrastructure exists (`src/orchestrator/plugin_loader.py`)
- ✅ Factory integration complete (`src/orchestrator/factory.py`)
- ✅ CI workflow exists (`.github/workflows/plugin-api-test.yml`)
- ⏳ Needs external repository and integration

## Requirements

### 1. External Repository

- [ ] Create repository: `test-plugin-multiagent`
- [ ] Implement minimal test plugin (see `docs/TEST_PLUGIN_SPEC.md`)
- [ ] Add CI workflow to test plugin loading
- [ ] Add README with setup instructions

### 2. CI Integration

- [ ] Integrate into main framework CI
- [ ] Add to PR checks (run on plugin-loader/factory changes)
- [ ] Ensure workflow runs on schedule (weekly)
- [ ] Add failure notifications

### 3. Testing

- [ ] Plugin discovery tests
- [ ] Factory integration tests
- [ ] Pipeline execution tests
- [ ] Contract validation tests

### 4. Documentation

- [ ] Document plugin development workflow
- [ ] Add to contributing guide
- [ ] Create plugin development tutorial

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Test plugin repository exists and is public
- [ ] CI validates plugin loading automatically
- [ ] Integration tests pass
- [ ] Workflow runs on relevant PRs
- [ ] Documentation complete

## Test Plugin Spec

See `docs/TEST_PLUGIN_SPEC.md` for complete specification.

**Minimal Requirements**:
- TestAgent implementing BaseFunctionalAgent
- TestAdvisor implementing BaseAdvisor
- Entry points registered in pyproject.toml
- Basic functionality tests

## CI Workflow

The workflow (`.github/workflows/plugin-api-test.yml`) should:
1. Create test plugin dynamically
2. Install it
3. Test discovery
4. Test factory integration
5. Test pipeline execution

## Related

- See `docs/TEST_PLUGIN_SPEC.md` for specification
- See `.github/workflows/plugin-api-test.yml` for CI workflow
- See `docs/PLUGIN_API.md` for API documentation
```

## Issue 4: PyPI Publishing

**Title**: `[v1.1] Publish to PyPI`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `pypi`, `release`

**Milestone**: `v1.1.0`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Publish package to PyPI for easy installation via `pip install multi-agent-system`.

## Prerequisites

- [ ] Entry points finalized and tested
- [ ] CLI entry point (`multiagent`) complete
- [ ] All features stable and tested
- [ ] Documentation complete

## Tasks

### 1. Package Metadata

- [ ] Add `long_description` from README to `pyproject.toml`
- [ ] Add classifiers:
  - [ ] Python versions (3.8, 3.9, 3.10, 3.11, 3.12)
  - [ ] Development Status (4 - Beta → 5 - Production/Stable)
  - [ ] Topics (AI, multi-agent, automation, etc.)
  - [ ] License (MIT)
- [ ] Add `author` and `author_email`
- [ ] Add `url` and `project_urls`

### 2. Testing

- [ ] Test build: `python -m build`
- [ ] Validate: `twine check dist/*`
- [ ] Test on TestPyPI first
- [ ] Verify installation: `pip install multi-agent-system`
- [ ] Test entry points work

### 3. Publishing

- [ ] Configure `PYPI_TOKEN` secret
- [ ] Verify workflow (`.github/workflows/publish-pypi.yml`)
- [ ] Publish to PyPI
- [ ] Verify package on PyPI

### 4. Documentation

- [ ] Update installation instructions
- [ ] Add PyPI badge to README
- [ ] Document installation from PyPI
- [ ] Update quickstart guide

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Package installable via `pip install multi-agent-system`
- [ ] Entry points work correctly (`multiagent`, `multiagent-new`, etc.)
- [ ] CLI commands work after installation
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] PyPI page looks professional

## Example Installation

```bash
# Install from PyPI
pip install multi-agent-system

# Verify installation
multiagent --version
multiagent doctor

# Run pipeline
multiagent --pipeline pipeline/production.yaml --preset mvp-fast
```

## Workflow

The workflow (`.github/workflows/publish-pypi.yml`) automatically:
- Builds package on tag push (`v*`)
- Validates with twine
- Publishes to PyPI

## Related

- See `docs/BUILD_WHEELS.md` for build instructions
- See `.github/workflows/publish-pypi.yml` for workflow
- See `pyproject.toml` for current configuration
```

---

## Issue 5: Artifact Retention Policy v2

**Title**: `[v1.1] Enhanced Artifact Retention Policy`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `feature`, `retention`

**Milestone**: `v1.1.0`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Enhance artifact retention with category-based TTL/Quota, per run-owner policies, and "what-if" simulation.

## Current Status

- ✅ Basic retention exists (`scripts/clean_artifacts.py`)
- ✅ Simple TTL and size-based cleanup
- ✅ Weekly retention job (`.github/workflows/retention-weekly.yml`)
- ⏳ Needs category-based and per-owner policies

## Requirements

### 1. Category-Based Retention

- [ ] Define categories:
  - `requirements` - Requirements docs (longer retention)
  - `codegen` - Generated code (shorter retention)
  - `docs` - Documentation (medium retention)
  - `reports` - Execution reports (short retention)
- [ ] Set TTL per category
- [ ] Set quota per category

### 2. Per Run-Owner Policies

- [ ] Track run owner (user, CI, etc.)
- [ ] Different policies per owner:
  - User runs: longer retention
  - CI runs: shorter retention
  - Nightly tests: medium retention
- [ ] Configurable per owner

### 3. What-If Simulation

- [ ] Simulate cleanup without executing
- [ ] Show what would be deleted
- [ ] Show space savings
- [ ] Show impact per category/owner

### 4. Enhanced Reporting

- [ ] Retention report per category
- [ ] Per-owner statistics
- [ ] Space usage trends
- [ ] Cleanup recommendations

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Category-based retention works
- [ ] Per-owner policies implemented
- [ ] Simulation mode available
- [ ] Reports generated correctly
- [ ] Integration with weekly job works
- [ ] Tests pass

## Example Usage

```bash
# Category-based cleanup
python cli.py clean --category requirements --older-than 30d
python cli.py clean --category codegen --older-than 7d

# Per-owner cleanup
python cli.py clean --owner ci --older-than 3d
python cli.py clean --owner user --older-than 90d

# What-if simulation
python cli.py clean --simulate --category codegen --older-than 7d
```

## Related

- See `scripts/clean_artifacts.py` for current implementation
- See `.github/workflows/retention-weekly.yml` for weekly job
```

---

## How to Create Issues

1. Go to: `https://github.com/<owner>/<repo>/issues/new`
2. Copy title and body from each issue above
3. Add labels (listed at top of each issue)
4. Assign to milestone: `v1.1.0`
5. Create issue

## Milestone Setup

Create milestone `v1.1.0`:
- **Title**: `v1.1.0`
- **Description**: `See docs/V1.1_ROADMAP.md`
- **Due date**: Set target date (e.g., Q2 2025)
